page.title: 03TRANSPORT-VEHICLES ETC.
page.content:
Our area survey indicates that 88% of families/homes own and use a car, 12% also operate motorcycles, and all homes possess at least one bicycle.
In order to live reasonably in a rural area such as this, some means of independent transport would seem essential for most people. There are no bus services in the area, and those who are elderly, infirm or handicapped are dependent on good will of neighbours or organisations.
Our team lists family outings, shopping, visiting relatives and holidays as reasons for owning a car. Our team's parents might want to add to this that running a car is essential for getting to and from work.
